metadata.title: W3Schools.com
metadata.Keywords: HTML, Python, CSS, SQL, JavaScript, How to, PHP, Java, C, C++, C#, jQuery, Bootstrap, Colors, W3.CSS, XML, MySQL, Icons, NodeJS, React, Graphics, Angular, R, AI, Git, Data Science, Code Game, Tutorials, Programming, Web Development, Training, Learning, Quiz, Exercises, Courses, Lessons, References, Examples, Learn to code, Source code, Demos, Tips, Website
metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: Human Intelligence
About 70 000 years ago, something happened to the human brain.
content.html: About 70 000 years ago, something happened to the human brain.

content.text: Humans started to develop "Cognitive Intelligence":
content.html: Humans started to develop "Cognitive Intelligence":

content.text: Words and Numbers
Using words, was a big step in the development of human intelligence:
content.html: Using words, was a big step in the development of human intelligence:

content.text: "Elephant" is more informative than "Big Animal".
content.html: "Elephant" is more informative than "Big Animal".

content.text: Understanding numbers, was also a big step:
content.html: Understanding numbers, was also a big step:

content.text: "5" or "50" is more informative than "few" or "many".
content.html: "5" or "50" is more informative than "few" or "many".

content.text: Languages
"There is a lion behind the big oak" is more informative than shouting "Danger!".
content.html: "There is a lion behind the big oak" is more informative than shouting "Danger!".

content.text: Having a language is probably a key characteristic that distinguishes us from animals.
content.html: Having a language is probably a key characteristic that distinguishes us from animals.

content.text: Abstract Thinking
Abstract thinking is thinking about things that are not concrete , like freedom, or ideas, or concepts.
content.html: Abstract thinking is thinking about things that are not concrete, like freedom, or ideas, or concepts.

content.text: Abstract
A freedom figure
content.html: A freedom figure

content.text: Abstract
Freedom The Past The Future Imagination Explanation
content.html:
Freedom
The Past
The Future
Imagination
Explanation

content.text: Concrete
A concrete figure
content.html: A concrete figure

content.text: Concrete
My Mouth My Fingertip One Apple Two Chicken Three Horses

content.text: Many everyday behaviors use abstract thinking:
content.html: Many everyday behaviors use abstract thinking:

content.text: What is Intelligence?
There is no proven definition of Intelligence .
content.html: There is no proven definition of Intelligence.

content.text: Intelligence can be defined as:
content.html: Intelligence can be defined as:

content.text: Intelligence can be defined as a collection of knowledge:
content.html: Intelligence can be defined as a collection of knowledge:

content.text: "Intelligence could be defined as the process of obtaining knowledge by efficient means."
content.html: "Intelligence could be defined as the process of obtaining knowledge by efficient means."

content.text: Yampolsky (2013)
content.html: Yampolsky (2013)

content.text: The challenge of AI is to understand what intelligence is, and how intelligence works.
content.html: The challenge of AI is to understand what intelligence is, and how intelligence works.

content.text: What is the difference between human knowledge and artificial intelligence?
content.html: What is the difference between human knowledge and artificial intelligence?

content.text: Intelligence might be a type of algorithms in our brains or in our genes.
content.html: Intelligence might be a type of algorithms in our brains or in our genes.

content.text: Later in this tutorial you will learn more about intelligent algorithms.
content.html: Later in this tutorial you will learn more about intelligent algorithms.

content.text: Is the Human Brain Superior?
Can animals, birds, insects, or plants think?
content.html: Can animals, birds, insects, or plants think?

content.text: Humans have bigger brains than animals.
content.html: Humans have bigger brains than animals.

content.text: Big dogs have bigger brains than small dogs. Are big dogs smarter?
content.html: Big dogs have bigger brains than small dogs. Are big dogs smarter?

content.text: Birds have very small brains, but they know they should not make children in the autumn, and they know when to fly to the south.
content.html: Birds have very small brains, but they know they should not make children in the autumn, and they know when to fly to the south.

content.text: Bees have even smaller brains, but they know how to communicate about where to find nectar.
content.html: Bees have even smaller brains, but they know how to communicate about where to find nectar.

content.text: Plants have no brain, but they know how to reproduce, and how to prepare for the winter.
content.html: Plants have no brain, but they know how to reproduce, and how to prepare for the winter.
